pr_title: Wikidata extension - discourage use of main password

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this link instead to Mediawiki's help pages explaining bot passwords? Instead of our wiki?  It would be better if we didn't have to maintain this page, I think.  But let's see what @wetneb thinks.
timeline.author: thadguidry
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -80,6 +80,8 @@ "wikibase-preview/new-id": "new item", "wikibase-account/dialog-header": "$1 account", "wikibase-account/explain-log-in": "Logging in to $2 lets you to upload edits directly from OpenRefine.", + "wikibase-account/explain-bot-passwords": "You are encouraged to login with bot passwords, see this wiki to learn how to get one.",

replies.bodyText: We need a wiki to explain which "Applicable grants" are needed, merely the link to the MediaWiki's manual seems not enough.
replies.author: afkbrb

replies.bodyText:
Wikidata is a wiki.  Wikipedia is a wiki.  Both have Special_Pages, manual pages and Help pages.  I think we should just point to use one of them.  I don't think this is entirely OpenRefine specific.  Here's a number of them, there are probably more on mediawiki.org that I am not aware of.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MediaWiki:Botpasswords-summary
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:Pywikibot/BotPasswords
https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Creating_a_bot/en
https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:BotPasswords
https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:SpecialPages
https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Tools/OpenRefine
I think one of those might be used instead and then expanded upon within it?
I don't know.
@wetneb probably would or have contacts that do know.
replies.author: thadguidry

replies.bodyText: I think it makes sense to have OpenRefine-specific documentation, at least for the Applicable grants.
replies.author: wetneb
